interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Galaxy Quest (Widescreen Edition) [DVD]
Review Date: 2021/01/08
Store: Tim Allen  (Actor),     Sigourney Weaver  (Actor),     Dean Parisot  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Science Fiction & Fantasy, Science Fiction, Comedy
Product Description: ['Product Description', 'For four years, the courageous crew of the NSEA Protector - "Commander Peter Quincy Taggart" (Tim Allen), "Lt. Tawny Madison" (Sigourney Weaver) and "Dr. Lazarus" (Alan Rickman) - set off on thrilling and often dangerous missions in space . . . and then their series was canceled!', 'Now, twenty years later, aliens under attack have mistaken the', 'Galaxy Quest', 'television transmissions for "historical documents" and beamed up the crew of has-been actors to save the universe. With no script, no director and no clue, the actors must turn in the performances of their lives in this hilarious adventure Jeffery Lyons (NBC-TV) calls "The funniest, wittiest comedy of the year."', 'Amazon.com', "You don't have to be a", 'Star Trek', 'fan to enjoy', 'Galaxy Quest', ', but it certainly helps. A knowingly affectionate tribute to', 'Trek', "and any other science fiction TV series of the 1960s and beyond, this crowd-pleasing comedy offers in-jokes at warp speed, hitting the bull's-eye for anyone who knows that (1)\xa0the starship captain always removes his shirt to display his manly physique; (2)\xa0any crew member not in the regular cast is dead meat; and (3)\xa0the heroes always stop the doomsday clock with one second to spare. So it is with Commander Taggart (Tim Allen) and the stalwart crew of the NSEA", 'Protector', ", whose intergalactic exploits on TV have now been reduced to a dreary cycle of fan conventions and promotional appearances. That's when the Thermians arrive, begging to be saved from Sarris, the reptilian villain who threatens to destroy their home planet.", 'Can actors rise to the challenge and play their roles for real? The Thermians are counting on it, having studied the "historical documents" of the', 'Galaxy Quest', 'TV show, and their hero worship (not to mention their taste for Monte Cristo sandwiches) is ultimately proven worthy, with the help of some', 'Galaxy', 'geeks on planet Earth. And while', 'Galaxy Quest', 'serves up great special effects and impressive Stan Winston creatures, director Dean Parisot (', 'Home Fries', ') is never condescending, lending warm acceptance to this gentle send-up of sci-fi TV and the phenomenon of fandom. Best of all is the splendid cast, including Sigourney Weaver as buxom blonde Gwen DeMarco; Alan Rickman as frustrated thespian Alexander Dane; Tony Shalhoub as dimwit Fred Kwan; Daryl Mitchell as former child-star Tommy Webber; and Enrico Colantoni as Thermian leader Mathesar, whose sing-song voice is a comedic coup de grâce.', '--Jeff Shannon']
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Action & Adventure', 'Format': 'Anamorphic, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, DVD, NTSC, Widescreen, Surround Sound', 'Contributor': 'Dean Parisot, Tim Allen, Alan Rickman, Sigourney Weaver', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 42 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.35:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 0.55 inches; 0.01 Ounces', 'Director': 'Dean Parisot', 'Media Format': 'Anamorphic, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, DVD, NTSC, Widescreen, Surround Sound', 'Run time': '1 hour and 42 minutes', 'Release date': 'May 2, 2000', 'Actors': 'Tim Allen, Sigourney Weaver, Alan Rickman', 'Studio': 'Dreamworks Video', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: Just a classic!  One of the greatest semi-parody space movies ever made.  Rivals the actual films and TV series it is mocking.  If you haven't seen it, get it.
Review Title: Not a cult classic..
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
The Fifth Element (Remastered) [Blu-ray] Bruce Willis (Actor), Gary Oldman (Actor), Luc Besson (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG-13 Format: Blu-ray Movies & TV, Featured Categories, Blu-ray, Action & Adventure ['Product Description', "New York cab driver Korben Dallas didn't mean to be a hero, but he just picked up the kind of fare that only comes along every five thousand years: A perfect beauty, a perfect being, a perfect weapon. Together, they must save the world. Bruce Willis, Milla Jovovich, and Gary Oldman star in acclaimed director Luc Besson's outrageous sci-fi adventure, an extravagantly styled tale of good against evil set in an unbelievable twenty-third century world. Now presented in full 4K resolution, experience this dynamic action favorite like never before.", 'Amazon.com', "Ancient curses, all-powerful monsters, shape-changing assassins, scantily-clad stewardesses, laser battles, huge explosions, a perfect woman, a malcontent hero--what more can you ask of a big-budget science fiction movie? Luc Besson's high-octane film incorporates presidents, rock stars, and cab drivers into its peculiar plot, traversing worlds and encountering some pretty wild aliens. Bruce Willis stars as a down-and-out cabbie who must win the love of Leeloo (Milla Jovovich) to save Earth from destruction by Jean-Baptiste Emmanuel Zorg (Gary Oldman) and a dark, unearthly force that makes Darth Vader look like an Ewok.", '--Geoff Riley'] {'Genre': 'Action, Sci-Fi', 'Format': 'Blu-ray, Subtitled, Dolby, Color, Widescreen, Anamorphic', 'Contributor': 'Gary Oldman, Bruce Willis, Milla Jovovich, Luc Besson, Ian Holm, Chris Tucker', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), French (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 6 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.40:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '6.75 x 5.25 x 0.3 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '3350191', 'Director': 'Luc Besson', 'Media Format': 'Blu-ray, Subtitled, Dolby, Color, Widescreen, Anamorphic', 'Run time': '2 hours and 6 minutes', 'Release date': 'July 17, 2007', 'Actors': 'Bruce Willis, Gary Oldman, Ian Holm, Milla Jovovich, Chris Tucker', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish, French, Portuguese, Thai, Mandarin Chinese', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures', 'Number of discs': '1'} Looks and sounds AMAZING. Best experience with this movie I've ever had. Seriously a well done remaster. Looks and sounds AMAZING. Best experience with this movie I've ever had {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Jeremiah Chechik'], 'Producers': ['William S. Beasley', 'Mauri Syd Gayton', 'Daniel Grodnik', 'John Hughes', 'Tom Jacobson', 'Matty Simmons', 'Ramey E. Ward'], 'Starring': ['Chevy Chase', "Beverly D'Angelo", 'Juliette Lewis'], 'Studio': ['Warner Bros.']} One of the Top 20 movies of any childhood. This is a fantastic series, and having them on BluRay AND Digital to watch on my iPad makes me one happy camper. Picked this up on sale Alita: Battle Angel Blu-ray Rosa Salazar (Actor), Christoph Waltz (Actor), Roberto Rodriguez (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG-13 Format: Blu-ray Movies & TV, Featured Categories, Blu-ray ['A deactivated cyborg is revived, but cannot remember anything of her past life and goes on a quest to find out who she is.'] {'Genre': 'Action/Adventure', 'Format': 'NTSC, Subtitled', 'Contributor': 'Casper Van Dien, Lana Condor, Eiza Gonzalez, Mahershala Ali, Keean Johnson, Rick Yune, Racer Maximiliano Rodriguez-AvellÃ¡n, Idara Victor, Jennifer Connelly, Jorge Lendeborg, Derek Mears, Hugo Perez, Jeff Fahey, Leonard Wu, Marko Zaror, Christoph Waltz, Jackie Earle Haley, Roberto Rodriguez, Laeta Kalogridis, Ed Skrein, James Cameron, Rosa SalazarCasper Van Dien, Lana Condor, Eiza Gonzalez, Mahershala Ali, Keean Johnson, Rick Yune, Racer Maximiliano Rodriguez-AvellÃ¡n, Idara Victor, Jennifer Connelly, Jorge Lendeborg, Derek Mears, Hugo Perez, Jeff Fahey, Leonard Wu, Marko Zaror, Christoph Waltz, Jackie Ear… See more', 'Language': 'English', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.6 x 5.2 x 6.7 inches; 1.41 Ounces', 'Director': 'Roberto Rodriguez', 'Media Format': 'NTSC, Subtitled', 'Release date': 'July 23, 2019', 'Actors': 'Rosa Salazar, Christoph Waltz, Mahershala Ali, Ed Skrein, Keean Johnson', 'Dubbed': 'French, Spanish', 'Studio': 'TWENTIETH CENTURY FOX', 'Writers': 'James Cameron, Laeta Kalogridis', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '2'} Great movie! Definitely going to be a cult classic in about a decade. Excellent Movie {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Danny DeVito'], 'Producers': ['Andrew Lazar', 'Peter Macgregor-Scott'], 'Starring': ['Robin Williams', 'Edward Norton', 'Catherine Keener'], 'Studio': ['WARNER BROS.']} Wife decided we had to watch this movie ASAP, so we bought the streaming version. Wish there was a BluRay version at a reasonable price, but I guess we'll be able to watch this again as long as it's available online.

Great movie. It's a classic - Norton is fantastic, and Williams is an absolute gem. Wish there was a BluRay {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Dean Parisot'], 'Producers': ['Ray Bouderau', 'Courtney Chenn', 'Scott H. Cohen', 'Patrick W. Dugan', 'Scott Fischer', 'Elliot Grainge', 'Grant Guthrie', 'Brent Guttman', 'David Haring'], 'Starring': ['Keanu Reeves', 'Alex Winter', 'Kristen Schaal'], 'Studio': ['United Artist Releasing']} This film is by far the best sequel a movie could ever have. Stays true to the roots of the originals with only a bit of retcon going on. Without giving anything away, the best character has to be Dennis. Wow...The whole family has been quoting this movie for a couple of weeks now. It's a must-watch if you're a fan of the originals. Such a good job. Most excellent {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Michael Engler'], 'Producers': ['Gareth Neame', 'Julian Fellowes', 'Liz Trubridge', 'Nigel Marchant', 'Brian Percival'], 'Starring': ['Hugh Bonneville', 'Jim Carter', 'Michelle Dockery'], 'Studio': ['Focus Features']} My wife started watching the series a few weeks back and once it was finished she just had to watch the movie. I mean..I kinda liked it. I was never a fan of soap operas, but this one isn't half bad. Fine, I liked it. Flight of the Navigator Joey Cramer (Actor), Veronica Cartwright (Actor), Randal Kleiser (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG Format: DVD Movies & TV, Science Fiction & Fantasy, Fantasy ['Product Description', 'David Freeman (Joey Cramer) is an ordinary boy destined for a most extraordinary adventure -- aboard a spectacular, futuristic spacecraft. After a mystifying disappearance, David returns, possessing vast, undiscovered knowledge about the farthest reaches of the universe. With these sudden navigational powers, David is able to take the fantastic flying machine anywhere he desires, accompanied by both its wisecracking robotic commander, Max, and an assortment of bizarre extraterrestrial creatures! Embark on a fun-filled, fast-paced journey of fantasy and adventure as David takes off on the flight of a lifetime! Also featuring Sarah Jessica Parker and the voice of Paul Reubens.|The movie was filmed in Broward County, Florida, and, at the other extreme, Norway.|Sarah Jessica Parker makes one of her first film appearances in this 1986 flick.|Paul Reubens (Pee-wee Herman) stars as the voice of Max, a wisecracking robotic spaceship commander.', 'Amazon.com', "Disney's 1986", 'Flight of the Navigator', "combines a strong ensemble cast and classic '80s soundtrack with dazzling special effects for a high-flying sci-fi adventure. While searching for his little brother in the woods, 12-year-old David Freeman (Joey Cramer) falls down a ravine and is knocked unconscious. After what seems like minutes, he returns home, only to discover that eight years have passed since he was declared missing and presumed dead. Even more mystifying is that David hasn't aged, nor can he account for the time lapse. Meanwhile, NASA officials stumble upon a futuristic spacecraft and are determined to assess what David knows about it by locking him in a top-secret lab for scanning and testing. His only chance of escape is in the spacecraft manned by Max, a wisecracking robot. Cramer gives an earnest performance, which overcomes an imperfect script, while enough one-liners and imaginative animation will keep families engaged. Watch for Sarah Jessica Parker in one of her first film appearances. Rated PG for language. (Ages 6 and older)", '--Lynn Gibson'] {'Genre': 'ACTION, Action/Adventure, LIVE', 'Format': 'Color, NTSC, Subtitled, Surround Sound, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Richard Liberty, Sarah Jessica Parker, Brigid Cleary, Michael Burton, Cliff De Young, Paul Reubens, Veronica Cartwright, Ted Bartsch, Michael Strano, Cynthia Caquelin, Raymond Forchion, Gizelle Elliot, Robert Small, Matt Adler, Jonathan Sanger, Matt MacManus, Howard Hesseman, Albie Whitaker, Iris Acker, Randal Kleiser, Joey CramerRichard Liberty, Sarah Jessica Parker, Brigid Cleary, Michael Burton, Cliff De Young, Paul Reubens, Veronica Cartwright, Ted Bartsch, Michael Strano, Cynthia Caquelin, Raymond Forchion, Gizelle Elliot, Robert Small, Matt Adler, Jonathan Sanger, Matt MacManus, Howar… See more', 'Language': 'Unqualified, English (Dolby Surround)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 30 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.6 x 5.5 x 7.5 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '2259724', 'Director': 'Randal Kleiser', 'Media Format': 'Color, NTSC, Subtitled, Surround Sound, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 30 minutes', 'Release date': 'June 1, 2004', 'Actors': 'Joey Cramer, Veronica Cartwright, Cliff De Young, Sarah Jessica Parker, Matt Adler', 'Subtitles': 'French, Spanish', 'Studio': 'WALT DISNEY PICTURES', 'Writers': 'Michael Burton, Matt MacManus', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} This is one of those movies I watch at least once a year. An all-time favorite. David gets sent to the future...He's obviously the same, but his family has aged. Travels across the globe with the assistance of a sentient spacecraft voiced by Peewee. What's not to like? profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Primary Interests:** The user continues to have a strong enthusiasm for action and sci-fi movies, alongside a profound appreciation for high-quality TV series with rich narratives. Nostalgic comedies from their childhood remain significant, reflecting cherished memories.

- **Media Format Preference:** The user prefers Blu-ray and high-quality remasterings, but is open to DVD and streaming options when necessary, emphasizing their commitment to an optimal viewing experience.

- **Rating Trends:** With a consistent high average rating of 4.8, the user exhibits a discerning taste for outstanding storytelling and production quality. Their recent interaction highlights their love for nostalgic favorites, showcasing a willingness to appreciate content that marries humor with adventure.

- **Favorite Themes:** Unique storytelling with elements of adventure and fantasy, alongside nostalgia and humor, continues to be a significant draw.

- **Director and Actor Appreciation:** While maintaining admiration for directors like Luc Besson and actors such as Bruce Willis, the user is expanding their appreciation to include talents like Tim Allen and Sigourney Weaver, reflecting a growing interest in diverse storytelling.

- **Review Behavior:** The user shares enthusiastic, detailed reviews that focus on emotional connections and personal enjoyment. Their latest review praises a beloved comedic classic, reinforcing their joyful engagement with nostalgic content that resonates emotionally and humorously.
